paper.title: Describing Data with the Support Vector Shell in Distributed Environments
paper.abstract: Distributed data streams mining is increasingly demanded in most extensive application domains, like web traffic analysis and financial transactions. In distributed environments, it is impractical to transmit all data to one node for global model. It is reasonable to extract the essential parts of local models of subsidiary nodes, thereby integrating into the global model. In this paper we proposed an approach SVDDS to do this model integration in distributed environments. It is based on SVM theory, and trades off between the risk of the global model and the total transmission load. Our analysis and experiments show that SVDDS obviously lowers the total transmission load while the global accuracy drops comparatively little.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究分布式环境下的数据流挖掘和模型集成方法，虽然提到了金融交易作为应用领域之一，但并未具体涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等特定金融研究领域。
